methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Create a new event on the given selection and text field.

params.name: field
params.comment: the field having focus at the time of the event.

methods.name: getSelection
methods.comment:
Get the item that was selected at the time of the event.
 
 For activation, this is the activated suggestion.

methods.javadoc:
Get the field having focus at the time of the event.
 
 If the autocompleter is attached to multiple fields, this can be used to identify which
 field produced the event.
@return the focused field
methods.name: getField
methods.comment:
Get the field having focus at the time of the event.
 
 If the autocompleter is attached to multiple fields, this can be used to identify which
 field produced the event.

methods.javadoc:
Prevent this event from being further processed.
 
 The actual completion action will still be completed, though.
methods.name: consume
methods.comment:
Prevent this event from being further processed.
 
 The actual completion action will still be completed, though.

methods.javadoc:
Check if this event has been consumed by an earlier listener.
@return true if the event has been consumed, i.e., should not be further processed.
methods.name: isConsumed
methods.comment: Check if this event has been consumed by an earlier listener.

return.comment: true if the event has been consumed, i.e., should not be further processed.

methods.javadoc:
Prevent the actual completion action from taking place.
 
 Further listeners may still process this event, though.
methods.name: cancel
methods.comment:
Prevent the actual completion action from taking place.
 
 Further listeners may still process this event, though.

methods.javadoc:
Check if the actual completion action will be performed.
@return true if the completion action has been cancelled.
methods.name: isCancelled
methods.comment: Check if the actual completion action will be performed.

return.comment: true if the completion action has been cancelled.

name: AutocompletionEvent
comment: An event related to autocompletion, usually a completion being activated by the user.
